intro: Pycnocoma trilobata, commonly known as the three-lobed pycnocoma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
